item.title: The Three Tiers
item.description: network_switch Working towards the CCNA Cisco talks about a hierarchical network there are threeÂ layers to this design. Access Layer, distribution layer and the core layer. Each of them have their own set of functions and is also considered to be a best practice when the network continues to grow and for redundancy along with just a better way to manage it. The Access layer is the layer that devices connect to, such as PCs, printers, and IP Phones.
